intro: Brachycodon pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf brachycodon, is a small, flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. Its succulent leaves are fleshy and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Brachycodon pumilus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive floral display.
